name: Landis, Admrx., v. Conestoga Transportation Company et al., Appellant; Kuhn, Admr., v. Same

judges: Before Maxey,C.J.,Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Hughes, JJ.
parties: Landis, Admrx., v. Conestoga Transportation Company et al., Appellant. Kuhn, Admr., v. Same.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Horace Stern,
These appeals by Conestoga Transportation Company were taken merely by way of “counter-attack” against the appeals of Miller Motor Freight Service, to be pressed only if the latter appeals should be sustained. Accordingly, these appeals are dismissed.
Judgments affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Horace Stern,

casebody.head_matter:
Landis, Admrx., v. Conestoga Transportation Company et al., Appellant. Kuhn, Admr., v. Same.
(No. 2)
Argued January 14, 1944.
Before Maxey,C.J.,Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Hughes, JJ.
March 20, 1944:
